items.title: Taiwan to review TSMC investment in US, gov’t says
items.summary:
- Taiwanese government to evaluate TSMC's proposed US investments for strategic alignment in semiconductor industry.
- TSMC plans to invest $100 billion, including five new chip manufacturing facilities.
- Announcement made by TSMC CEO and former President Trump on Mar. 3, 2025.

items.title: Dubai-based auto firm, BYD partner to launch EV trucks, buses
items.summary:
- Dubai's Al-Futtaim Industrial Equipment partners with BYD to launch electric trucks and buses in the UAE.
- The event showcased four electric vehicles: ETM6 Electric Truck, EV Light Truck T5, EV Medium Truck ETH8, and B12 Electric Bus.
- Vehicles produce zero tailpipe emissions and have battery capacities from 126 kWh to 425 kWh.
- The B12 Electric Bus can travel 550 kilometers on a single charge.
- The launch aligns with UAE’s sustainability goals and aims to reduce carbon emissions in commercial transport.

items.title: A letter to my younger self: Be unapologetically you
items.author: Maria
items.summary:
- This letter is part of Tech in Asia’s 2025 International Women’s Day campaign.
- The author reflects on life achievements and emphasizes that smaller moments are more important than traditional successes.
- Three key pieces of advice:
  1. Embrace authenticity despite societal pressures.
  2. Develop a strong sense of agency to change your life.
  3. Prioritize meaningful relationships and experiences over work.

items.title: Indonesian online F&B spending hits $12.9b in 2024: report
items.summary:
- Online spending on food and beverages in Indonesia reached 212.2 trillion rupiah (US$12.90 billion) in 2024 according to We Are Social.
- Food purchases accounted for 177.7 trillion rupiah (US$10.81 billion) and beverage spending was 34.5 trillion rupiah (US$2.1 billion).
- Online food and beverage transactions became the largest e-commerce category, surpassing electronics and fashion.
- The food delivery segment generated 88.9 trillion rupiah (US$5.41 billion), with GrabFood leading at 47%, followed by GoFood at 35% and ShopeeFood at 18%.
- ShopeeFood experienced strong growth, surpassing Foodpanda in Thailand.
- GoFood’s best-selling item, chicken rice, remained popular for six consecutive years, with expectations for iced Americano and chicken dishes to rise in popularity in 2025.

items.title: US-based AI massage robot firm Aescape nets $83m in funding
items.summary:
- New York-based startup Aescape Inc. raises US$83 million led by Valor Equity Partners.
- Estimated valuation at approximately US$250 million, not confirmed by Aescape.
- Funding will help introduce robotic massage systems at Four Seasons Hotels and Marriott International.
- Aescape's technology is operational in 40 locations; plans to distribute an additional 400 units by year-end.
- Aescape also exploring markets in physical therapy and professional sports.

items.title: Indian EV maker converts to public firm ahead of 2025 IPO
items.summary:
- An Indian electric vehicle (EV) maker has transformed into a public company to prepare for its IPO scheduled in 2025.
- The news indicates a growing trend in the EV sector as companies position themselves for future growth.
- This move could have implications for investment in the Indian EV market.

items.title: Tencent’s Yuanbao becomes China’s most downloaded iPhone app
items.summary:
- Tencent’s AI chatbot, Yuanbao, is the most downloaded free app in China’s iOS App Store as of March 3, 2025.
- Yuanbao was launched in May 2024 and saw a surge in popularity following Tencent’s integration of DeepSeek’s R1 reasoning model in February 2025.
- A download button in Tencent’s WeChat app, which has 1.3 billion users, likely contributed to the increase in downloads.
- Daily active users of Yuanbao reached 3 million by late February 2025, a significant rise from hundreds of thousands.

items.title: Israeli AI virtual agents firm raises $7m seed funding
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Alta, an Israeli AI company, has raised US$7 million in seed funding.
- The funding round was led by Entrée Capital and Target Global, with contributions from Ben Lang and Gavin Patterson.
- Founded in 2023, Alta develops AI-powered virtual agents for sales and revenue operations.
- The virtual agents, Katie and Luna, automate tasks like lead research and data analysis.
- Alta’s technology integrates with over 50 tools, including CRM and ERP systems.
- The company is targeting Fortune 500 firms and small to medium-sized businesses for its offerings.

items.title: Trump may tighten AI chip curbs as China’s gray market grows
items.summary:
- The Trump administration is considering tighter restrictions on AI chip exports to China.
- Current restrictions on high-performance AI chip exports began in October 2022 to limit China’s AI advancements.
- Demand for Nvidia’s AI chips in China remains strong, leading to a growing gray market facilitated by intermediaries in Vietnam, Malaysia, and Taiwan.
- Traders bypass restrictions by altering identification numbers, delivering hundreds of restricted servers monthly.
- Nvidia and authorities have increased inspections, but merchants continue to evade regulations.
- Chinese firms rely on the gray market or alternative products, such as Nvidia’s H20 chips, for AI training needs.

items.title: Sea’s Q4 revenue surges 39.6%, Shopee powers growth
items.summary:
- Sea Ltd reported a 36.9% increase in Q4 revenue, reaching US$4.95 billion, surpassing expectations of US$4.62 billion.
- Shopee, its ecommerce platform, accounted for over two-thirds of total revenue, growing 41.3% due to strong holiday season spending.
- SeaMoney, the digital financial services division, saw revenue surge by 55.2%, exceeding projections of 35.3%.
- Garena anticipates double-digit growth in user base and bookings in 2025.
- In September, Sea partnered with YouTube for direct purchases from Shopee via YouTube links in Indonesia.
- Following the earnings report, Sea Ltd’s shares jumped 11% in premarket trading.

items.title: Tesla stock drops as anti-Musk backlash grows, sales fall
items.summary:
- Tesla’s stock fell 3% on Mar. 3, adding to a 28% drop in February, marking its worst monthly loss since December 2022, with a market cap of about $915 billion.
- The decline follows CEO Elon Musk's statement about potential for a "1000% gain" if execution is exceptional.
- Tesla faced an 8% drop in automotive revenue and a 23% decline in operating income for Q4 2024, with forecasts of continued challenges from falling prices and new tariffs.
- Sales in Europe dropped significantly, with Germany reporting a 60% decline in registrations in January.
- Increased competition from Chinese automakers and advancements in self-driving technology pose additional challenges.
- Tesla plans to launch its unsupervised full self-driving service in Austin by June 2025 and expand to more cities later.

items.title: Israeli cyber startup Aryon Security bags $9m seed funding
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Aryon Security raises $9 million in seed funding led by Viola Ventures and Blumberg Capital.
- Notably backed by industry figures including Shlomo Kramer, Maty Siman, and Rubi Aronashvili.
- The team comprises former members of Israel’s elite IDF unit, Matzov, led by CEO Ron Arbel.
- Aryon targets a proactive approach to cloud security with its Cloud Security Enforcement Platform.
- The platform aims to address misconfigurations, which account for 99% of cloud security breaches per Gartner.
- Aryon integrates with existing infrastructures, including Infrastructure as Code (IaC).

items.title: Ex-SentinelOne executive joins $4b Israel VC firm as partner
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Vintage Investment Partners, a $4B venture capital firm in Israel, has appointed Iren Reznikov as a partner.
- Reznikov has a background in enterprise infrastructure software and cybersecurity, previously managing a $100M venture fund at SentinelOne.
- She led a $50M global fund at Cisco and worked with YL Ventures, adding notable companies like Medigate and Axonius to her investment portfolio.

items.title: Indonesia’s crypto transactions surge 104% in January
items.summary:
- Crypto transactions in Indonesia reached 44.07 trillion rupiah (US$2.68 billion) in January 2025.
- This is a 104.31% increase from 21.57 trillion rupiah (US$1.31 billion) in January 2024.
- Total crypto transactions for 2024 amounted to 650.6 trillion rupiah (US$39.56 billion).
- 1,396 crypto assets are currently available for trading as of February 2025.
- The OJK has authorized 19 entities related to crypto transactions, with 14 more pending.
- A working group was formed for oversight after the regulatory transition from Bappebti to OJK.

items.title: Hakuhodo, SC Ventures partner to expand, tokenize anime
items.summary:
- Hakuhodo DY Media Partners and SC Ventures signed a MoU to expand Japanese IPs, including anime and manga.
- The agreement addresses global demand and focuses on Asia and the Middle East, particularly Indonesia, Singapore, and Thailand.
- SC Ventures' "Project Engram" will connect rights holders with licensed fund managers for monetization of Japanese IPs.
- The collaboration will explore tokenization opportunities to create tokenized IP assets.

items.title: Indian D2C home appliances firm Nuuk nets $4.6m series A
items.summary:
- Nuuk, an Indian D2C home appliances brand, raised ₹40 crore (US$4.6 million) in series A funding led by Vertex Ventures and supported by Temasek.
- Total funding reaches ₹65 crore (US$8 million), including backing from Good Capital and investors Rohit Kapoor and Vivek Gambhir.
- Funds will be used for product development, local production, and brand building, aiming for over 50% domestic manufacture by 2025-26.
- Founded in 2023, Nuuk sells fans, vacuum cleaners, garment care devices, and juicers/blenders, primarily through its website and e-commerce platforms, with Amazon as its largest revenue source.
- The funding reflects strong investor interest in India’s D2C market, projected to reach US$300 billion by 2030, competing with brands like Philips, Bajaj, and Atomberg.

items.title: Indonesia’s pay later debt hits $1.81b
items.summary:
- In January 2025, pay later transactions in Indonesia reached 29.69 trillion rupiah (US$1.81 billion).
- This marks a nearly 50% increase from December 2024.
- Year-on-year growth in pay later transactions by financing companies was 41.9%, totaling 7.12 trillion rupiah (US$433 million).
- Bank-facilitated pay later transactions increased by 46.45% year-on-year, totaling 22.57 trillion rupiah (US$1.37 billion).
- The number of bank-facilitated pay later accounts rose to 24.44 million, a 0.29% increase in total bank credit disbursement.
- A survey indicates that 70.4% of pay later users are aged 18 to 35 years.

items.title: AI brand agent platform Firsthand nets $26m series A
items.author: Jonathan Heller, Michael Rubenstein, Wei Wei
items.summary:
- Firsthand, a New York-based startup, raised US$26 million in series A funding.
- The funding round was led by Radical Ventures; included FirstMark Capital, Aperiam Ventures, and Crossbeam Venture Partners.
- Previously raised US$6.6 million in seed funding, also led by Radical Ventures.
- Notable earlier angel investors: David Rosenblatt, former DoubleClick CEO, and Bob Lord, Horizon Media president.

items.title: Apple launches developer academy in Bali
items.summary:
- Apple has launched a developer academy in Bali, Indonesia, to empower local talent and foster innovation.
- The academy will provide training in app development and entrepreneurship, aiming to boost the local tech ecosystem.
- This initiative aligns with Apple's commitment to supporting education and economic growth globally.

items.title: Xpeng to test autonomous driving system in Hong Kong
items.author: He Xiaopeng
items.summary:
- Xpeng plans to test its autonomous driving system, the Xpeng Navigation Guided Pilot (X NGP), in Hong Kong.
- This is part of Xpeng's global expansion strategy targeting right-hand drive markets.
- Trials will begin soon, although an exact timeline has not been specified.
- Xpeng also aims to enter other markets, including Thailand, as part of its expansion efforts.

items.title: Asia layoff tracker: Mass layoffs hit Ola Electric, Flipkart
items.summary:
- Ola Electric has cut over 1,000 employees to focus on profitability.
- Flipkart confirmed the shutdown of its Ans Commerce platform as it prepares for a potential IPO.
- Total funding in Southeast Asia, India, and China dropped to US$45 billion in 2024, one-third of 2021's peak.
- India has experienced the most layoffs in Asia since July 2021 due to economic pressures.
- Big Tech companies are also laying off employees, with IBM planning to cut 1,800 jobs in China.

items.title: J Trust Bank files police report against fintech startup Crowde
items.summary:
- PT J Trust Indonesia Tbk, operating as J Trust Bank, filed a police report against Crowde for alleged embezzlement.
- The report was filed on Feb. 11, 2025, under the number STTLP/B/982/II/2025/SPKT/Polda Metro Jaya.
- Allegations include fictitious loans issued in the names of farmers who either did not know about the loans or denied applying for them.
- J Trust Bank previously collaborated with Crowde for peer-to-peer lending to farmers.
- The bank reported Crowde's CEO Yohanes Sugihtononugroho and other management members to the authorities.

items.title: Digital frame makers Aura, Cozyla to lose Google photo auto-sync by March 2025
items.summary:
- Google announced changes to its Photos API, impacting digital photo frame functionalities of Aura and Cozyla.
- Aura's Google Photos auto-sync will be disabled from March 17, 2025; users must upload photos manually via the Google Photos app.
- The new Google Photos Picker API will restrict access to specific photos or albums, eliminating direct cloud library integrations.
- Cozyla will also discontinue its auto-sync feature, details pending.
- Users have alternative methods like iCloud integration, but they do not fully replace the convenience of auto-sync.
- Google plans to expand slideshow capabilities for third-party devices, but this will not compensate for the lost auto-sync feature.

items.title: Sea posts $237.6m net profit in Q4, misses estimates
items.summary:
- Sea reported a net profit of US$237.6 million for Q4 2024, up from a loss of US$111.6 million in Q4 2023.
- Earnings fell short of analysts' estimates of US$239.3 million, while revenue increased to US$5 billion, surpassing the US$4.7 billion estimate.
- Full-year net profit doubled to US$447.8 million, with revenue rising to US$16.8 billion, a 28.8% increase from the previous year.
- Shopee's GMV for Q4 was US$28.6 billion, a 23.5% year-on-year increase, with Q4 revenue also up to US$3.7 billion.
- Free Fire's Q4 bookings reached US$543.2 million, up 19% from the prior year.
- SeaMoney became Sea’s second-largest business unit, with full-year revenue hitting US$2.4 billion, growing 34.6%.

items.title: Chinese startup Baichuan restructures enterprise team, focus on healthcare AI
items.summary:
- Baichuan, a Beijing-based AI startup, has dissolved its finance and banking division on March 3, 2025.
- The shift in focus is towards AI healthcare, including pediatric solutions and medical assistants in collaboration with Beijing Children’s Hospital.
- The move indicates a reduction in the financial AI sector amid the rise of open-source models like DeepSeek R1, with Baichuan citing healthcare as having less competition.

items.title: Sea Group’s financial health in 7 charts
Senior exec takes over as Foodpanda SG managing director
items.summary:
- Bhavani Shankar Mishra appointed as new managing director of Foodpanda Singapore, effective Mar. 4.
- Mishra, who was a senior director of operations, succeeds Aditi Sharma, who left for personal reasons.
- Mishra joined Foodpanda in 2018, initially working in logistics in Thailand.
- Foodpanda operates in 11 markets across Asia, with key operations in Singapore.

items.title: How BYD edged out Hyundai in Indonesia
items.summary:
- Hyundai initially led Indonesia's electric vehicle (EV) market in 2023 but was overtaken by BYD last year.
- BYD's lead was supported by Indonesian government incentives, including an import tax exemption for EVs.
- Hybrid vehicles continue to outsell EVs in Indonesia, but the gap is closing, with Hyundai introducing hybrids to compete better.
- Hyundai is focusing on exports due to market volatility, having been Indonesia’s fourth-largest car exporter last year.

items.title: Meet the 100 top-funded startups and tech companies in China
Indian B2B fintech Rupifi to raise $146m in bridge round
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Rupifi, a B2B fintech startup in India, is raising $146 million in a bridge funding round.
- The funding involves the issuance of 66,427 pre-series B3 compulsorily convertible preference shares at $2,082 each.
- Founder Anubhav Jain mentioned that investors can initially subscribe to $2 million, with $144 million in unsubscribed shares to be disposed of.
- The capital will be used to support growth and business expansion.

items.title: US chipmaker Microchip to lay off 2k workers
items.summary:
- Microchip Technology plans to reduce its workforce by about 2,000 positions, or approximately 9% of its staff.
- The layoffs are due to declining demand from the automotive sector, resulting in sluggish sales and excess inventory.
- Affected locations include manufacturing facilities in Gresham, Oregon, Colorado Springs, Colorado, and a plant in the Philippines.
- The company expects restructuring costs of US$30 million to US$40 million for severance and related expenses.
- Finalization of layoffs is expected by the end of the June quarter.
- Closure of Arizona chip manufacturing operations has been expedited to May, earlier than previously scheduled.

items.title: Indonesian fisheries startup Aruna cuts 40% of jobs
items.author: Farid Naufal Aslam
items.summary:
- Aruna, an Indonesian fisheries startup, has laid off approximately 40% of its workforce.
- Layoffs began in December 2024 and continued into January 2025 as part of a strategic restructuring effort.
- CEO Farid Naufal Aslam highlighted the need for long-term sustainability amid challenges in the fisheries and agribusiness sectors, impacting investor sentiment and funding access.

items.title: Israeli biomedical firm Nurami bags $30m
items.author: Nora Nseir, Dr. Amir Bahar
items.summary:
- Nurami Medical raised US$30 million in its latest funding round.  
- The funding will be used to expand workforce and scale operations, including a new manufacturing facility and R&D lab.  
- The company focuses on neurological surgeries, specifically products for cerebrospinal fluid leakage.  
- Established in 2014, Nurami has developed a nanofiber-based surgical patch that received FDA approval for post-surgical recovery.

items.title: Vingroup signs MOU with Qatar’s JTA Investment Group
items.summary:
- On Mar. 4, Vingroup and Qatar-based JTA Investment Group signed an MOU for strategic investments in Vingroup’s EV and tourism sectors.
- The MOU includes a potential equity investment of at least US$1 billion from JTA Investment in VinFast, Vingroup’s EV manufacturing subsidiary listed on Nasdaq.
- The agreement aims to establish a strategic partnership to support VinFast’s global expansion and technological growth.

items.title: Google Colab launches AI agent tool for data insights
items.summary:
- Google Colab has introduced a new AI agent tool aimed at providing data insights.
- The tool is designed to assist users in analyzing data more efficiently.
- This launch is part of ongoing efforts to integrate AI capabilities into data handling solutions.

items.title: US payment firm Yuno sets up regional HQ in Qatar
items.summary:
- Yuno, a US-based payment firm, has officially set up its regional headquarters in Qatar.
- The establishment aims to enhance Yuno's presence in the Middle East market.
- Qatar's strategic location is seen as beneficial for expanding financial services across the region.

items.title: PwC India launches emerging tech accelerator program
items.summary:
- PwC India launches the “Emerging Tech Startup Challenge” to support startups in AI, blockchain, spacetech, and data analytics.
- The three-month program targets 15 late-stage startups with series A or B funding and at least two commercial implementations.
- Selected startups will receive 25 hours of free consulting on tech, market strategy, valuation, funding, and taxation.
- Applications open on Mar. 5 and close on May. 5, with selections finalized by June.

items.title: Podcasting platform Podcastle debuts AI text-to-speech model
items.summary:
- Podcastle has launched Asyncflow v1.0, an AI text-to-speech model.
- The platform introduced an API for developers to integrate this model into applications.
- Asyncflow v1.0 features over 450 AI-generated voices for text narration.
- The model offers lower training and inference costs compared to competitors like ElevenLabs and Speechify, aimed at marketing, education, and content creation.

items.title: US VC firm General Catalyst faces leadership exits
items.summary:
- General Catalyst, managing US$32 billion, experiences leadership changes with three managing directors leaving.
- Departing directors include Deep Nishar, Kyle Doherty, and Adam Valkin, who were key in their respective investment strategies.
- The exits follow a merger with La Famiglia and the acquisition of Venture Highway in 2023, but reasons for departures remain undisclosed.

items.title: Spacetech startup TakeMe2Space nets $629.5k pre-seed funding
items.author: Ronak Kumar Samantray
items.summary:
- TakeMe2Space raised 5.5 crore rupees (US$629,500) in pre-seed funding led by Seafund.
- Additional investors include Blume Ventures, Artha Venture Fund, AC Ventures, and several angel investors.
- Funding will support the launch of MOI-1, India’s first AI laboratory in space.
- The startup aims to address satellite data processing challenges directly in space.
- The investment will aid in scaling its product portfolio, enhancing R&D, and targeting new global markets.

items.title: China urges DeepSeek, AI sector to focus on intelligence
items.summary:
- The National Natural Science Foundation of China (NSFC) emphasizes AI development should aim at advancing intelligence instead of just enhancing computing power.
- This statement follows discussions about AI models developed by [DeepSeek](https://www.techinasia.com/news/china-urges-deepseek-ai-sector-to-focus-on-intelligence).
- Lu Jianhua from NSFC stressed the need for breakthroughs in core technologies and better integration of hardware and software for practical applications in the AI sector.

items.title: 50 rising startups in China
PayPal-backed Mintoak acquires fintech firm for $22.9m
items.summary:
- Mintoak, a Mumbai-based fintech startup, has acquired Digiledge, which specializes in bill payments and CBDC.
- Digiledge will operate as a fully owned subsidiary of Mintoak.
- Mintoak has allocated 200 crore rupees (US$22.9 million) for further acquisitions targeting complementary services for small enterprises.
- The company provides QR-based payment technology to major banks like HDFC Bank, Axis Bank, and SBI, competing with PhonePe and Paytm.
- Mintoak processes about 30,000 crore rupees (US$3.4 billion) monthly for three million merchants, with expansions to Kuwait, UAE, Tanzania, and Mauritius.
- The acquisition will enhance Mintoak's bill payment services and explore CBDC for better merchant support in digital currency transactions.

items.title: Tencent Cloud unveils platform to build super app
items.summary:
- Tencent Cloud launched its Super App-as-a-Service (TCSAS) at MWC Barcelona on Mar. 4.
- TCSAS enables businesses to integrate mini apps with features like instant messaging, live streaming, and ecommerce, leveraging Tencent’s WeChat experience.
- Orange Middle East & Africa is an early adopter, using TCSAS for its “Max It” super app, expected to serve 45 million users this year.
- Other adopters include Telkomsel and Bank Rakyat Indonesia, utilizing the platform for digital transformation across various industries such as telecommunications and banking.

items.title: BYD to raise $5.05b in largest post-IPO share sale
items.summary:
- BYD, China’s largest EV manufacturer, plans to raise up to US$5.05 billion through a primary share placement.
- The company will issue 118 million shares priced between US$42.82 and US$44.37 each, representing a discount of 5.1% to 8.4% to the Mar. 3 closing share price of US$46.76.
- This is BYD’s largest post-IPO fundraising since its 2002 listing in Hong Kong, following a previous US$3.84 billion raise in 2021.
- The additional funds are sought due to increasing competition in China's EV sector, where price wars are affecting profitability.

items.title: Google’s Gemini Live brings voice AI to iPhone lock screen
items.summary:
- Google introduced Gemini Live, enabling voice AI on iPhone lock screens.
- The feature aims to enhance user convenience by providing voice control access.
- Gemini Live integrates seamlessly with various iOS functionalities.

items.title: South Korea’s EV market grows as Kia, Volvo take on Tesla
items.summary:
- Tesla faces increasing competition in South Korea with local automakers launching competitively priced EVs.
- Tesla's Model Y electric SUV became the third-largest imported car in South Korea in 2024, selling 29,750 units.
- Volvo launched the EX30 compact electric SUV, while Kia recently introduced the EV4, its first compact electric sedan.
- Audi and Volkswagen are also set to release new EV models in the Korean market.

items.title: Chinese robot maker Ubtech deploys humanoid walker robots
items.summary:
- UBTech Robotics has deployed humanoid Walker S1 robots at Zeekr’s electric vehicle factory in Ningbo, China.
- The robots assist in manufacturing by lifting heavy boxes and processing delicate materials, with around 20 units currently operational.
- They perform tasks autonomously, including assembly, testing, quality control, and vehicle door processing.
- Upcoming milestones include mass production plans set for the end of 2025, with 500-1000 Walker S robots to be delivered this year.

items.title: Malaysian firm NationGate denies link to Nvidia fraud
items.summary:
- NationGate Holdings denies connection to a Singapore fraud case involving Nvidia chips, clarifying the case pertains to an unrelated cloud partner.
- The company emphasizes its commitment to transparency and regulatory compliance, stating it will monitor the situation.
- NationGate responded to Bursa Malaysia regarding its stock decline, claiming unawareness of the reasons behind it.
- On Mar. 3, NationGate shares dropped 29.73% to 1.30 ringgit (US$0.29), reaching the limit down with 48.85 million shares exchanged.

items.title: BYD Korea’s Atto 3 delayed over subsidy compliance issues
items.summary:
- Delivery of BYD Korea’s Atto 3 electric SUV has been delayed due to non-compliance with updated subsidy requirements from South Korea’s Ministry of Environment.
- Over 1,000 preordered units are currently stored at a port in Pyeongtaek, Gyeonggi Province, pending approval.
- The ministry's revised rules mandate a battery state of charge (SoC) function for electric vehicles, which allows drivers to monitor battery energy levels.
- BYD Korea plans to update the Atto 3’s software to meet this requirement within a year, but approval of this adjustment is still pending.
